page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: Three Bridges railway station was first opened in 1841 as astation on the London to Brighton line.In 1848 the line to Horsham was opened.In 1855 the line to East Grinstead was opened (this was closed in 1967 and now forms the disused line mentioned in A2). This then in 1923 became part of the Southern Region.The line became electrified in 1933. The Nationalis- ation of Britains RAilways took place in1948 and this line became part of British Rail.In 1841 it took 1 hour 45 minutes to travel from London Bridge to Brighton at a cost of 9/6d (48p) compared with 1hour 20 minutes at a cost of Â£6.00.In 1966-7 steam trains were replaced by the total use of either deisel or electric trains.
